inclusion.criterion: FEV1 reversibility of at least 12% following bronchodilator administration
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: Able to perform reproducible spirometry according to American Thoracic Society (ATS)
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

inclusion.criterion: History of clinical varicella or varicella vaccine
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Ability of parent to provide informed consent
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: He is a chef with a history of asthma for 3 years, suffering from frequent cough, wheezing, and shortness of breath and chest tightness.

inclusion.criterion: If female, willing to use an effective form of contraception
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Corticosteroid treatment for any condition prior to study entry within the following defined timepoints: Oral - Use within 2 weeks of the screening visit
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: He doubled his oral corticosteroids in the past week.

exclusion.criterion: Current or prior use of medications known to significantly interact with corticosteroid disposition (within a 2-week period of study visit 1)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Pre-bronchodilator FEV1 less than 60% predicted at study visit 1
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

exclusion.criterion: More than three hospitalizations for asthma in the year prior to study entry
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Presence of chronic or active lung disease other than asthma
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: Spirometry was performed revealing a forced expiratory volume in the first second (FEV1) of 63% of the predicted.

exclusion.criterion: History of cataracts, glaucoma, or any other medical disorder associated with an adverse effect to corticosteroids
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Gastroesophageal reflux symptoms not controlled by standard medical therapy
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: History of significant asthma exacerbation within 2 weeks of study visit 1 or more than 5 courses of systemic corticosteroids in the year prior to study entry
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a history of asthma and meets some inclusion criteria, but also has some exclusion criteria. Further evaluation is needed to determine eligibility.
